news.title: Ghaziabad: Higher FAR, mixed land use set to boost TOD zone revenue by 200%
news.para: Ghaziabad's rapid rail corridor will see significant revenue boosts with the implementation of the transit-oriented development policy. The policy increases floor area ratio by 33-50% and allows mixed land use, projected to raise revenue by over 200%. Ghaziabad Development Authority and NCRTC will share this revenue equally.

news.title: Houses constructed by slum development board to be distributed in Hubballi in November
news.para: Karnataka will distribute 42,346 houses on November 29 in Hubballi. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah will lead the grand event. The state government is bearing beneficiary contributions for house construction. This initiative aims to provide homes to the poor. The government is committed to completing housing projects. The Chief Minister will serve his full term.

news.title: Chandigarh administration faces new hurdles for projects exceeding ₹1.5 crore
news.para: Chandigarh's engineering department has identified priority projects, including new schools and a PU-PGI underpass, awaiting financial approval from the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA). This follows an MHA order withdrawing powers for projects exceeding Rs 1.5 crore and tender acceptance from UT officials, causing procedural confusion. Departments are seeking exemptions for routine repair and maintenance works.

news.title: Maan-Mhalunge planning scheme awaits Maharashtra government’s nod
news.para: The Mhalunge-Maan town planning scheme, a flagship project showcased in 2018, remains stalled despite renewed directives, leaving hundreds of landowners in uncertainty.  Officials cite pending state government clearance, while affected residents express frustration over their inability to develop or sell their land, demanding immediate action or a clear explanation for the delay.

news.title: Unplanned construction, climate fury wreck Darjeeling
news.para: Unregulated construction and deforestation, exacerbated by climate change, have caused widespread devastation in Darjeeling's hills, particularly Mirik.  Incessant rains triggered massive landslides, claiming over 30 lives and displacing numerous families. The Chief Minister is reviewing restoration efforts and providing aid to affected communities.

news.title: Uttarakhand: Construction halted in 900 illegal colonies in Udham Singh Nagar
news.para: The District Development Authority has imposed a blanket ban on construction in approximately 900 illegal colonies across Udham Singh Nagar district to curb unauthorized urban expansion. This action follows rampant encroachments and unregulated building activities, with the administration noting a surge in land sales via stamp deeds over legal registrations. Strict legal action and demolition will be taken against violators.

news.title: Noida: Society residents protest concrete plant, say it is blocking road
news.para: Residents of Jaypee Greens Kensington Park Apartments are protesting a nearby ready-mix concrete plant, alleging health hazards and lack of approvals. The plant, reportedly set up by Jaypee Infratech Limited, has also blocked a two-way road. Despite previous shutdowns, residents claim the builder is attempting to restart operations and encroach on the road.

news.title: HC junks Uttar Pradesh government's order to cancel ‘zero-period’ waiver to builder
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has quashed a state government order that withdrew lease rent waivers granted to realtor Express Builders under the "zero period" policy. This ruling follows similar judgments for other developers, reinforcing that the Infrastructure and Industrial Development Commissioner lacked the authority to reverse prior decisions.

news.title: Bengaluru realty firms question need for Jakkur flying school NOC for projects
news.para: Credai Bengaluru is raising concerns over the municipal corporation's requirement for a no-objection certificate from the Government Flying Training School (GFTS) at Jakkur for project approvals. The association argues that GFTS's license has not been renewed since December 2023, and safety concerns make issuing a legitimate NOC impossible, leading to significant project delays.

news.title: Jaipur development body demarcates 27 zones under master plan 2047
news.para: Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) has finalized new zone demarcations for Master Plan 2047, increasing the total from 18 to 27 zones. This restructuring incorporates new villages, particularly in Zones 15 to 25, while central business districts in Zones 1 to 8 remain unchanged. Divisional commissioners are temporarily overseeing the expanded zones.

news.title: Nagpur civic body to auction 149 properties over tax dues
news.para: Nagpur Municipal Corporation is intensifying property tax recovery by identifying 149 properties for auction to collect ₹3.29 crore in long-pending dues. This move follows the recovery of ₹95.3 crore through tax warrants, as total arrears exceed ₹938.7 crore. The corporation aims to boost funding for critical projects through these aggressive enforcement measures.

news.title: Infrastructure woes hit affordable housing demand in Pune
news.para: Dwindling low-cost homes and poor infrastructure on city outskirts are dampening affordable housing demand in Pune. Developers face challenges with power, water, and roads, while residents struggle with long commutes and inadequate flat sizes. High land costs push projects to peripheries, creating accessibility issues.

news.title: Delhi: Many residents vacate Signature View Apartments as court-set deadline ends
news.para: Residents of Signature View apartments in Mukherjee Nagar began vacating the complex on Sunday, the final day of a court-mandated deadline. The Resident Welfare Association confirmed that water and power supply will be disconnected after October 12th, with approximately 90 residents remaining. The DDA previously declared the 336-flat complex structurally unsafe due to severe deterioration.

news.title: Punjab splits change of land use from building plans to boost investment
news.para: Punjab has delinked Change of Land Use (CLU) permission from building and layout plan approvals, restoring a previous system to expedite development. This move allows investors to secure bank loans and departmental clearances earlier. CLU permissions are now valid for two years with a one-time, two-year extension option.

news.title: Telangana HC upholds protected tenants’ ownership over 200-acre Gachibowli land
news.para: The Telangana High Court has recognized the ownership rights of protected tenants over 200 acres of prime Gachibowli land, valued at ₹15,000 crore. The court set aside a sub-collector's order, upholding the RDO's 2013 findings and criticizing the sub-collector's hasty decision. The judgment clarifies that civil courts, not revenue authorities, should handle disputes over sale deeds between private parties.

news.title: EOW books promoters of SSLS Real Estate & Constructions for cheating investors of ₹19 crore
news.para: Cyberabad police have booked SSLS Real Estate promoters for allegedly defrauding investors of nearly ₹19.4 crore.  Accused father-son duo, K Upendra and Atchuta Rao, solicited funds with promises of quick returns.  Investors, including businessman Badari Nadh Gelli, lost significant amounts after cheques bounced and repayment promises were broken.  A case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita has been registered.

news.title: Urban expansion accelerates amid land conversion in North Goa
news.para: Goa's Town and Country Planning board has tentatively approved new zoning changes. These proposals point to rapid urban growth in North Goa villages. Many applications focus on areas like Salvador do Mundo and Assagao. Developers are seeking to convert land for real estate projects. This trend extends development into semi-rural and eco-sensitive regions.

news.title: Odisha government approves town planning scheme-8
news.para: Bhubaneswar's urban development gets a major boost with the state government's approval of Town Planning Scheme-8. Spanning over 560 acres in Andharua and Daspur, this project, led by BDA, will create modern infrastructure, including wide roads and essential utilities. Landowners will contribute 40% of their land for development, enhancing the value of their retained property and the city's liveability.

news.title: Telangana commits over ₹25,000 crore to Hyderabad's infra, backs real estate growth
news.para: Telangana ministers emphasized the state's commitment to infrastructure, housing, and tourism, calling real estate the economy's backbone. Significant investments are planned for water and sewerage systems, alongside major road projects. The government also highlighted plans for a green city and balanced urban growth, urging developers to focus on affordable housing.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh CM hands over keys of 160 houses in Gorakhpur under EWS scheme
news.para: Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath distributed keys to 160 families under the EWS/LIG housing scheme in Gorakhpur, fulfilling Diwali dreams. The project, developed by GDA, offers subsidized flats for economically weaker and lower-income groups. Additionally, the CM inaugurated and laid the foundation for 50 development projects worth Rs 118 crore.
